summary: SkelUlt: A unified social media video platform combining features from Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Facebook, and X for video posting and sharing
architectural_notes: Multi-platform video hosting combining Instagram/TikTok/YouTube/Facebook/X features
Requires video storage and streaming infrastructure
Social networking capabilities needed for user interactions
SkelMsg messaging system requires polling mechanism for message updates (real-time WebSocket alternative)
Video link sharing in SkelMsg allows users to share SkelUlt video URLs in conversations
SkelMsg is an integrated feature within SkelUlt, not a separate application
Vidles feature requires separate upload flow with aspect ratio (9:16) and duration validation (5s-150s)
Enable/Disable button uses existing follow system backend but provides clearer UI pattern next to engagement buttons
SkelUlt logo image asset needs to be accessible in both light and dark theme contexts
Friend system integrated into SkelMsg requires user search functionality and friend request management (pending/accepted states)
known_issues: White screen issue after Version 5 deployment - site not rendering content properly
Delete button (trash icon) on videos not functioning when clicked - users unable to delete their own videos despite confirmation dialog implementation
Video/Vidle deletion incorrectly removes both content types when they should be independent (user reported deleting a video also deleted a vidle)

existing_features.title: Implement user authentication system using Internet Identity to allow users to sign up, log in, and manage their accounts
Create user profile system with username, bio, profile picture, and follower/following counts
Implement video upload functionality allowing users to upload video files with title, description, and tags
Create a main video feed that displays uploaded videos in a scrollable format with video player, title, description, and creator information
Implement like functionality allowing users to like videos with visible like counts
Create commenting system allowing users to post text comments on videos with timestamps
Implement share functionality allowing users to copy video links
Create follow/unfollow system allowing users to follow other creators
Implement user profile page showing all videos uploaded by that user in a grid layout

Design a modern, vibrant social media interface with a bold neon-inspired color scheme (pink, cyan, electric green accents), rounded corners, smooth animations, and a mobile-first responsive layout that feels energetic and engaging
Update the project name in project_state.json from 'UltSkel' to 'SkelUlt'
Create a SkelMsg navigation option in the main Layout component header that opens a messaging interface, positioned alongside existing navigation items (home, upload, profile)
Create a conversation list view showing all users the authenticated user has exchanged messages with, displaying the most recent message preview and timestamp for each conversation
Implement a chat thread view that displays the full message history between the authenticated user and a selected conversation partner, with messages grouped by sender and displaying timestamps
Create a message input component with a text field and send button, plus a button to attach/share SkelUlt video links from the user's feed
Implement automatic message polling that checks for new messages every 3 seconds using React Query's refetchInterval to simulate real-time updates
Add a trash icon delete button to the VideoCard component that appears only when the authenticated user is the video creator, positioned prominently near other action buttons (like, comment, share)
Implement delete video functionality that shows a confirmation dialog when the trash icon is clicked, then calls the backend deleteVideo mutation and updates the UI optimistically
Add the same trash icon delete button to the VideoGrid component thumbnails that appears only for the authenticated user's own videos
Update the VideoUploadModal component to include a radio button or toggle option that allows users to select whether they are uploading a regular 'Video' or a 'Vidle' (short-form vertical video)

Add client-side validation in the VideoUploadModal that checks the selected video file's duration and aspect ratio when 'Vidle' is selected, displaying clear error messages if the file does not meet the requirements (5 seconds to 2:30 minutes duration, 9:16 aspect ratio)
Add a visual badge or label to VideoCard and VideoGrid components that displays 'Vidle' for short-form content to distinguish it from regular videos in the feed and profile pages
Add a dedicated 'Vidles' navigation option in the Layout component header that filters and displays only short-form vertical videos (Vidles), positioned alongside existing navigation items

Create a VidlesPage component that displays a vertical scrollable feed of only Vidles (short-form videos), optimized for viewing vertical 9:16 content with swipe or scroll navigation similar to YouTube Shorts
Add comprehensive React error boundaries to catch and display rendering errors in App.tsx, wrapping the Router component to prevent white screens from JavaScript errors
Add try-catch blocks and null safety checks to all React Query hooks in useQueries.ts to handle backend connection failures gracefully
Add fallback loading states and null checks to FeedPage.tsx, VidlesPage.tsx, ProfilePage.tsx, VideoDetailPage.tsx, and MessagingPage.tsx to prevent rendering failures when data is unavailable
Verify and fix the router configuration in App.tsx to ensure all routes (/, /vidles, /profile/:userId, /video/:videoId, /messages) are properly defined and accessible
Add defensive checks in useInternetIdentity.ts and useActor.ts to handle authentication initialization failures and prevent crashes when Internet Identity is unavailable
Add safe fallbacks and validation to VideoCard.tsx, VideoGrid.tsx, and all video-related components to handle missing video data properties (url, title, uploader) without crashing
Review and fix any import errors, missing dependencies, or module resolution issues in all frontend files that could prevent the application bundle from loading correctly
Add console logging at critical initialization points (main.tsx, App.tsx, route components) to help diagnose where the application fails to render if white screen persists after fixes

Add the SkelUlt logo (bold geometric text with cyan 'ULT' accent) to the top-left corner of the Layout component header, ensuring it is small in size and displays consistently in both light and dark modes
Add an Enable button next to the like button on all videos in VideoCard component that allows users to follow/subscribe to the video creator's channel
Implement smooth animation for the Enable/Disable button that transforms the button state from 'Enable' to 'Disable' on click with visual transition effects
Implement Disable button functionality that allows users to unfollow/unsubscribe from the video creator's channel when clicked in the Disable state
Debug and fix the delete button click handler in VideoCard component to ensure the confirmation dialog appears when the trash icon is clicked on user's own videos
Debug and fix the delete button click handler in VideoGrid component to ensure the confirmation dialog appears when the trash icon is clicked on user's own video thumbnails
Fix the useDeleteVideo mutation hook in useQueries.ts to ensure proper error handling and cache invalidation after successful video deletion
Add console logging to the delete button click handlers and mutation calls to help diagnose any remaining issues with the delete functionality

Create React Query hooks in useQueries.ts for friend system operations: useSendFriendRequest, useAcceptFriendRequest, useDeclineFriendRequest, useGetFriendRequests, useGetFriendsList, useUnfriend, and useSearchUsers
Add 'Add Friends' button to the MessagingPage component that opens a modal dialog with a search bar to find users by username
Create AddFriendsModal component that displays a search bar and shows search results with user avatars, usernames, and 'Send Request' buttons for each user
Create FriendRequestsList component that displays pending friend requests with accept and decline buttons for each request
Create FriendsList component that displays all accepted friends with profile pictures, usernames, and unfriend buttons
Integrate FriendRequestsList and FriendsList components into the MessagingPage layout, displaying them alongside the conversation list
Add friend status indicators to the messaging interface showing whether a conversation partner is a friend, has a pending request, or is not a friend
Reduce the video player size in VidlesPage.tsx by 40% to make vertical videos fit better on screen

Video feed display and browsing

Add search section to SkelUlt where users can search for channels (user profiles) and videos by title/description/tags with YouTube-like search results
